definition: to fasten/to button/button/buckle/knot/to arrest/to confiscate/to deduct (money)/discount/to knock/to smash, spike or dunk (a ball)/to cover (with a bowl etc)/(fig.) to tag a label on sb/(Tw) (loanword) code
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: After he pulled the trigger, the rifle kicked back and the hunter lost his balance.
sentences.chinese: 猎人扣动板机，猎枪的反冲力使他的身体失去了平衡。

sentences.english: The soldier pressed the trigger of his gun.
I pulled the trigger on my mig and beaded a nut down low, and then another and another.
sentences.chinese: 我扣动电焊上的扳机一个又一个地往下焊螺母。

sentences.english: He kept aiming his gun at me, but didn't squeeze off.
sentences.chinese: 他一直用枪瞄准着我，却没敢扣动扳机。

sentences.english: I raised the shotgun and pulled the trigger.
sentences.chinese: 我拿起猎枪，扣动了扳机。

sentences.english: The trigger point will occur when the distortion caused by government spending is completely unveiled.
sentences.chinese: 只要政府开支造成的扭曲被完全揭露，扳机就会扣动。

sentences.english: Before he could press the trigger, the plane had gone up again.
sentences.chinese: 他还来不及扣动板机，飞机又飞高了。

sentences.english: He put his finger on the trigger and pretended to shoot a soldier on top of the hay bale.
sentences.chinese: 他用手指扣动扳机，装着向麦垛上方的一个士兵开枪。

sentences.english: He put that bottle to his head and pulled the trigger.
sentences.chinese: 他把酒瓶放在了头上并扣动了手枪的扳机。

definition: roof of the mouth/to load (a gun)
to pull out/to pull a lever
to open fire/to shoot a gun
to aim at/to target/to point at/to be directed at/registration/alignment (mechanical engineering)
to open fire/to shoot a gun
